definition: being at a peak or culminating point, to the greatest degree or extent, the time when the Moon is fully illuminated, increase in phase
details:
adjective
- being at a peak or culminating point
= synonyms: broad
- having the normally expected amount
= example: having the normally expected amount
= synonyms: good
- having ample fabric
= synonyms: wide
- constituting the full quantity or extent
= synonyms: entire
- complete in extent or degree and in every particular
= example: complete in extent or degree and in every particular
= synonyms: total
- containing as much or as many as is possible or normal
= example: containing as much or as many as is possible or normal
- (of sound) having marked deepness and body
= example: (of sound) having marked deepness and body
- filled to satisfaction with food or drink
= example: filled to satisfaction with food or drink
= synonyms: replete
adverb
- to the greatest degree or extent
= synonyms: fully
noun
- the time when the Moon is fully illuminated
= example: the time when the Moon is fully illuminated
= synonyms: full moon
verb
- increase in phase
= synonyms: wax
- make (a garment) fuller by pleating or gathering
- beat for the purpose of cleaning and thickening
= example: beat for the purpose of cleaning and thickening
